guide.conclusion: If you are new to screen printing, you may want to buy a screen printing kit, which will come with pretty much all the printing supplies you will need.

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: With this project technique, you can make your own custom t-shirt or poster silkscreen without any darkroom or chemical access. The one specialized tool you need is a vinyl sign cutter, but you just need access to the vinyl cutter for one step. The stencil on the screen can last for years, and can allow you to print one or dozens of images.
guide.introduction_rendered:
With this project technique, you can make your own custom t-shirt or poster silkscreen without any darkroom or chemical access. The one specialized tool you need is a vinyl sign cutter, but you just need access to the vinyl cutter for one step. The stencil on the screen can last for years, and can allow you to print one or dozens of images.

Relevant parts
  • silkscreen frame
  • sign vinyl
  • Screen printing ink (water based)
Tools
  • Gimp - software
  • Ink knife
  • Printing Squeegee
  • Screen printing kit
  • vinyl cutter
  • weeding tool

lines.text: Choose a picture
lines.text_raw: Choose a picture

lines.text: The image you choose should already have reasonably high contrast. In these two examples, I picked some photos from my Flickr account. One was a Neil Young concert, and the other is a penguin I met on a beach in South Africa.
lines.text_raw: The image you choose should already have reasonably high contrast. In these two examples, I picked some photos from my Flickr account. One was a Neil Young concert, and the other is a penguin I met on a beach in South Africa.

lines.text: If your image is overly cluttered, or doesn't have high contrast, you will need to do extra editing work. This editing is possible, but may be frustrating if you are doing this for the first time.
lines.text_raw: If your image is overly cluttered, or doesn't have high contrast, you will need to do extra editing work. This editing is possible, but may be frustrating if you are doing this for the first time.

lines.text: I use GIMP for image editing: http://www.gimp.org Download it for free and install it. The program is pretty powerful, though it may take a bit to find the tools.
lines.text_raw: I use GIMP for image editing: http://www.gimp.org Download it for free and install it. The program is pretty powerful, though it may take a bit to find the tools.

lines.text: Crop the photo so that it just has the features you want.
lines.text_raw: Crop the photo so that it just has the features you want.

lines.text: To crop the image, put a selection box around the parts of the picture you want. Then go to the Image menu, and choose 'Crop to Selection' The parts of the image outside the box will be discarded.
lines.text_raw: To crop the image, put a selection box around the parts of the picture you want. Then go to the Image menu, and choose 'Crop to Selection' The parts of the image outside the box will be discarded.

lines.text: Adjust the contrast
lines.text_raw: Adjust the contrast

lines.text: The best way to do this step is with the Threshold Tool. This tool will convert a color image to black and white, and give you sliders to control the dark (contrast) and light (brightness) in one dialog box.
lines.text_raw: The best way to do this step is with the Threshold Tool. This tool will convert a color image to black and white, and give you sliders to control the dark (contrast) and light (brightness) in one dialog box.

lines.text: The way I used to do this was with the brightness and contrast tool, but it usually took a bunch of times to get it right, and often it didn't work at all. If you don't get the image just right, you will need to go around with the eraser tool and remove a lot of excess detail. Threshold is the way to go.
lines.text_raw: The way I used to do this was with the brightness and contrast tool, but it usually took a bunch of times to get it right, and often it didn't work at all. If you don't get the image just right, you will need to go around with the eraser tool and remove a lot of excess detail. Threshold is the way to go.

lines.text: Remove all the little bits you can with the Threshold tool, then clean up the image as needed with the eraser or paint brush. You want as much of the image as possible to be made of decent size shapes. If there are too many 'crumbs' then you will have extra work in the weeding process.
lines.text_raw: Remove all the little bits you can with the Threshold tool, then clean up the image as needed with the eraser or paint brush. You want as much of the image as possible to be made of decent size shapes. If there are too many 'crumbs' then you will have extra work in the weeding process.

lines.text: A simpler image is best to work with initially. After you get some experience with the process, you can work with more complex compositions.
lines.text_raw: A simpler image is best to work with initially. After you get some experience with the process, you can work with more complex compositions.

lines.text: Prepare the file for the vinyl cutter. I usually do this step with a program that bundles with the vinyl cutter: Roland Cut Studio. Some people use Inkscape http://inkscape.org/download/
lines.text_raw: Prepare the file for the vinyl cutter. I usually do this step with a program that bundles with the vinyl cutter: Roland Cut Studio. Some people use Inkscape http://inkscape.org/download/

lines.text: Add a box around the image. You want to leave a margin around your picture so that the ink won't seep around the edges. 2 to 3 inches on each side should be sufficient.
lines.text_raw: Add a box around the image. You want to leave a margin around your picture so that the ink won't seep around the edges. 2 to 3 inches on each side should be sufficient.

lines.text: If you don't have a screen already, stretch one. You can use a pre stretched screen, which is the simpler option. Otherwise, follow the steps below.
lines.text_raw: If you don't have a screen already, stretch one. You can use a pre stretched screen, which is the simpler option. Otherwise, follow the steps below.

lines.text: You can buy a painter's picture frame made of wood for this step. You'll need a piece of silkscreen mesh that is wider and longer than the frame. Make sure the surface where you're going to put the screen is flat, smooth, and free of staples.
lines.text_raw: You can buy a painter's picture frame made of wood for this step. You'll need a piece of silkscreen mesh that is wider and longer than the frame. Make sure the surface where you're going to put the screen is flat, smooth, and free of staples.

lines.text: Staple one edge of the screen to one side of the frame. Start in the center, then pull the screen straight as you staple the end of that same side. Pull the screen straight again as you staple the other end of that same side. Staple the centers of each section until your staples are about 1 inch apart. Use a hammer to flatten the staples.
lines.text_raw: Staple one edge of the screen to one side of the frame. Start in the center, then pull the screen straight as you staple the end of that same side. Pull the screen straight again as you staple the other end of that same side. Staple the centers of each section until your staples are about 1 inch apart. Use a hammer to flatten the staples.

lines.text: Pull the screen to the opposite side of the first side stapled. Staple the center, then the ends of this side, pulling as you staple. Staple the centers of each section until your staples are about 1 inch apart. Repeat this process for the other two ends of the frame.
lines.text_raw: Pull the screen to the opposite side of the first side stapled. Staple the center, then the ends of this side, pulling as you staple. Staple the centers of each section until your staples are about 1 inch apart. Repeat this process for the other two ends of the frame.

lines.text: When your screen is stretched, it should be tight like the surface of a drum. If it is loose, then you should make sure that you are pulling on the screen until the staple is out of the staple gun and into the frame.
lines.text_raw: When your screen is stretched, it should be tight like the surface of a drum. If it is loose, then you should make sure that you are pulling on the screen until the staple is out of the staple gun and into the frame.

lines.text: After the screen is stretched, trim off the excess screen material with a utility knife or scissors.
lines.text_raw: After the screen is stretched, trim off the excess screen material with a utility knife or scissors.

lines.text: Make a mask for the screen.
lines.text_raw: Make a mask for the screen.

lines.text: Make a window for the screen. Originally, I put the stencil on the screen, and then filled in the area around the stencil with masking tape and vinyl scraps. This keeps the ink from getting over the edge of the stencil and onto the shirt.
lines.text_raw: Make a window for the screen. Originally, I put the stencil on the screen, and then filled in the area around the stencil with masking tape and vinyl scraps. This keeps the ink from getting over the edge of the stencil and onto the shirt.

lines.text: The technique I like to use now, is make a mask that fits over the whole silkscreen frame with a hole in the middle. The hole in the middle will be the only place where ink can get through the screen. The stencil is positioned so that it fits over the opening of the mask. When you want to put a new stencil on, you leave the mask.
lines.text_raw: The technique I like to use now, is make a mask that fits over the whole silkscreen frame with a hole in the middle. The hole in the middle will be the only place where ink can get through the screen. The stencil is positioned so that it fits over the opening of the mask. When you want to put a new stencil on, you leave the mask.

lines.text: You could do this by hand, or you can design a computer file that has the cut lines. If you're going to do it by hand, you'll need a straight metal ruler and a sharp utility knife. Do the cutting on a cutting surface or work bench.
lines.text_raw: You could do this by hand, or you can design a computer file that has the cut lines. If you're going to do it by hand, you'll need a straight metal ruler and a sharp utility knife. Do the cutting on a cutting surface or work bench.

lines.text: Place a piece of vinyl that is the length and with of the frame, plus the height of the frame (x2), plus the with of the frame sides (x2) (optional) Make a square or rectangular hole in the center of this that is big enough for your image, for example 10" x 10".
lines.text_raw: Place a piece of vinyl that is the length and with of the frame, plus the height of the frame (x2), plus the with of the frame sides (x2) (optional) Make a square or rectangular hole in the center of this that is big enough for your image, for example 10" x 10".

lines.text: Peel the backing from the vinyl, and place the mask on the table with the adhesive side facing up. When you put the stretched screen frame on the vinyl, it will stick to the adhesive. Make sure the vinyl is attached as neatly as possible to the frame. Make some cuts from the edge of the frame to the edge of the vinyl to make it fold neatly.
lines.text_raw: Peel the backing from the vinyl, and place the mask on the table with the adhesive side facing up. When you put the stretched screen frame on the vinyl, it will stick to the adhesive. Make sure the vinyl is attached as neatly as possible to the frame. Make some cuts from the edge of the frame to the edge of the vinyl to make it fold neatly.

lines.text: Weed the stencil
lines.text_raw: Weed the stencil

lines.text: With a weeding tool, remove the parts of the stencil that you will want to have ink flow through. Make a weeding tool by taping a push pin to a ball point pen barrel (after removing the ink cartridge). You can also use a utility knife to pick up the parts. The pen-based weeding tool is the least expensive, and safest for doing this with kids.
lines.text_raw: With a weeding tool, remove the parts of the stencil that you will want to have ink flow through. Make a weeding tool by taping a push pin to a ball point pen barrel (after removing the ink cartridge). You can also use a utility knife to pick up the parts. The pen-based weeding tool is the least expensive, and safest for doing this with kids.

lines.text: Be careful not to remove parts of the image where you want no ink to flow.
lines.text_raw: Be careful not to remove parts of the image where you want no ink to flow.

lines.text: Having a black and white print of the image is very helpful at keeping a complex design clear in your mind as you do the weeding.
lines.text_raw: Having a black and white print of the image is very helpful at keeping a complex design clear in your mind as you do the weeding.

lines.text: Weed the whole image, and leave it on the backing paper.
lines.text_raw: Weed the whole image, and leave it on the backing paper.

lines.text: Add transfer tape to the stencil
lines.text_raw: Add transfer tape to the stencil

lines.text: Transfer tape is thinner, and less adhesive than masking tape. It is designed to hold the vinyl together until you put it on a surface. The rolls come in a variety of widths. Choose a roll that is just wide enough to cover your image.
lines.text_raw: Transfer tape is thinner, and less adhesive than masking tape. It is designed to hold the vinyl together until you put it on a surface. The rolls come in a variety of widths. Choose a roll that is just wide enough to cover your image.

lines.text: If you can have a friend help you with this step, it is easier. One person holds the tape down to the vinyl and the table, smoothing it on gradually and evenly. The other person holds the roll with two hands, keeping an even tension on the tape so that it can be attached to the vinyl without bubbles or wrinkles.
lines.text_raw: If you can have a friend help you with this step, it is easier. One person holds the tape down to the vinyl and the table, smoothing it on gradually and evenly. The other person holds the roll with two hands, keeping an even tension on the tape so that it can be attached to the vinyl without bubbles or wrinkles.

lines.text: You can use the squeegee to make sure the transfer tape goes on evenly, but your hands should be enough.
lines.text_raw: You can use the squeegee to make sure the transfer tape goes on evenly, but your hands should be enough.

lines.text: When you have the tape on the vinyl, cut the roll off of the stencil.
lines.text_raw: When you have the tape on the vinyl, cut the roll off of the stencil.

lines.text: Attach the stencil to the screen
lines.text_raw: Attach the stencil to the screen

lines.text: Position the stencil over the hole in the mask, inside the well of the silkscreen frame.
lines.text_raw: Position the stencil over the hole in the mask, inside the well of the silkscreen frame.

lines.text: Remove the backing, making sure that the vinyl stays stuck to the transfer tape.
lines.text_raw: Remove the backing, making sure that the vinyl stays stuck to the transfer tape.

lines.text: Neatly and evenly apply the stencil to the screen, making certain that the image will be completely inside the hole in the mask. Burnish or rub the stencil so that it is completely adhered to the screen.
lines.text_raw: Neatly and evenly apply the stencil to the screen, making certain that the image will be completely inside the hole in the mask. Burnish or rub the stencil so that it is completely adhered to the screen.

lines.text: Carefully remove the transfer tape from the stencil. The best way that I have found for this is to peel the transfer tape back as flat as possible. If you peel the transfer tape at any angle much less than 180 degrees, the vinyl will tend to stay stuck to the tape.
lines.text_raw: Carefully remove the transfer tape from the stencil. The best way that I have found for this is to peel the transfer tape back as flat as possible. If you peel the transfer tape at any angle much less than 180 degrees, the vinyl will tend to stay stuck to the tape.

lines.text: If the vinyl doesn't stick to the screen, fold the tape back over, and rub the vinyl. Next, try to peel the tape again, making certain that the vinyl stays stuck to the screen.
lines.text_raw: If the vinyl doesn't stick to the screen, fold the tape back over, and rub the vinyl. Next, try to peel the tape again, making certain that the vinyl stays stuck to the screen.

lines.text: Prepare the shirt for printing
lines.text_raw: Prepare the shirt for printing

lines.text: Remove the tags, and stickers from the shirts.
lines.text_raw: Remove the tags, and stickers from the shirts.

lines.text: I like to put a thickness of coroplast or 1/8" mdf inside the shirts. Putting a small stack of newspapers is useful as well. The shirt inert serves two purposes: Keep the ink from flowing to the back fabric of the shirt and add a bit of tension to the screen while printing, which will help you get a crisper print.
lines.text_raw: I like to put a thickness of coroplast or 1/8" mdf inside the shirts. Putting a small stack of newspapers is useful as well. The shirt inert serves two purposes: Keep the ink from flowing to the back fabric of the shirt and add a bit of tension to the screen while printing, which will help you get a crisper print.

lines.text: You shouldn't need to wash the shirts beforehand (unless they're already dirty) Brand new shirts seem to take the ink just fine.
lines.text_raw: You shouldn't need to wash the shirts beforehand (unless they're already dirty) Brand new shirts seem to take the ink just fine.

lines.text: Ink the screen and make the print
lines.text_raw: Ink the screen and make the print

lines.text: With the ink knife, put some screen printing ink into the well of the frame.
lines.text_raw: With the ink knife, put some screen printing ink into the well of the frame.

lines.text: Use the squeegee to draw the ink across your design.
lines.text_raw: Use the squeegee to draw the ink across your design.

lines.text: You want to use enough pressure to push the ink through the holes in the screen, but not so much pressure that the ink goes sideways beyond the stencil. This may take a bit of practice to get it right, and you can do some testing to get the correct touch for inking the shirts.
lines.text_raw: You want to use enough pressure to push the ink through the holes in the screen, but not so much pressure that the ink goes sideways beyond the stencil. This may take a bit of practice to get it right, and you can do some testing to get the correct touch for inking the shirts.

lines.text: When you have the shirt printed, you can take the insert out, or you can leave it during the drying process.
lines.text_raw: When you have the shirt printed, you can take the insert out, or you can leave it during the drying process.

lines.text: Dry and heat set the ink
lines.text_raw: Dry and heat set the ink

lines.text: The ink is water based, and will need to dry. You can speed this process up with an incandescent light bulb.
lines.text_raw: The ink is water based, and will need to dry. You can speed this process up with an incandescent light bulb.

lines.text: Once your shirts are dry, you will want to heat set the ink. If you skip this step, you might ruin a whole load of laundry.
lines.text_raw: Once your shirts are dry, you will want to heat set the ink. If you skip this step, you might ruin a whole load of laundry.

lines.text: To heat set the shirt(s) put them in the clothes dryer on high for 20 minutes or so. The label on the ink bottle might have a more precise amount of head set time.
lines.text_raw: To heat set the shirt(s) put them in the clothes dryer on high for 20 minutes or so. The label on the ink bottle might have a more precise amount of head set time.

lines.text: Behold the magic of wearing your own art.
lines.text_raw: Behold the magic of wearing your own art.

lines.text: You can make t-shirts for just you to wear once or twice, or you can make them for a group of people, like a robotics team, or you could make enough for your whole school band.
lines.text_raw: You can make t-shirts for just you to wear once or twice, or you can make them for a group of people, like a robotics team, or you could make enough for your whole school band.

lines.text: Many of the shirts I've made using this process have been in my wardrobe for years of happy use. I should make more of them. They make nice gifts, too.
lines.text_raw: Many of the shirts I've made using this process have been in my wardrobe for years of happy use. I should make more of them. They make nice gifts, too.

guide.summary: You can print t-shirts without a darkroom using this fabrication technique. You'll need a minimum of tools and supplies, and can do this project pretty much anywhere.
guide.title: Silkscreen Printing with a Vinyl Silkscreen
